intro: Bifaria mannii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15-30 cm and prefers bright, indirect light. It is widely cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. Bifaria mannii thrives in well-draining soil and requires moderate watering to prevent root rot.
